page.title: 15Local Events
page.content: The Louth and District Hunt takes place every year on Boxing Day.It begins at the Cattle Market at 10:30 am,with about 30 men and women taking part.The hunt covers a distance of 40 miles and finishes at around 5:30 pm. Louth's Sportsman Week is an annual event every July.In 1985 it was sponsored by Yorkshire Television and all the money raised went to a local charity.The events take place within a 10 mile radius of the town and include a 4 mile Fun Run,a half marathon and a clay pigeon shoot. The Playgoers are a company of amateur actors who perform about 8 plays a year at the theatre on Newmarket. Productions in 1985 included "Outside Edge" and "Mother Goose". A Fair comes to Louth every May and October.It takes over a carpark on Northgate.It is very popular.
